title: Array Methods
content: Having a thorough understanding of array methods will help you successfully solve algorithm challenges.

title: Template Literals
content: Using template literals can be a helpful alternative to put a string together that includes variables.

title: Async/Await
content: If you are using several callbacks in your code, you may find that using async/await will make more code more readable.

title: Bootstrap
content: When it comes to creating styled HTML pages quickly, using a CSS library such as Bootstrap can be particularly helpful.

title: Object-Oriented Programming
content: When creating full-stack applications, object-oriented programming can help organize your files.

title: The MVC Paradigm
content: To maintain a concrete separation of concerns, it can be helpful to use the MVC paradigm.

title: CSS Animations
content: CSS has the built-in functionality to create simple, light-weight animations.

title: Sequelize
content: If you are creating an application with several complex queries, using Sequelize can help ensure that you do not make any MySQL syntax errors.

title: ESLint
content: Linting can be a great way to catch errors before they become an issue later on.

title: Common Console Errors and How to Resolve Them
content: Many console errors are caused by scope concerns. Make sure that your variables are available to the functions that need them.

title: Template Engines
content: To generate HTML dynamically, template engines such as Handlebars can be a good solution.

title: Deploying to Heroku
content: Heroku will host your application's front-end and back-end, making it a great option for full-stack developers.

title: Resolving Merge Conflicts
content: There isn't a one size fits all when it comes to merge conflicts. Consult with your team to make sure that the resolution you select is the correct option.

title: Status Codes
content: To create a RESTful API, including status codes in the server responses are essential.
